items.name: Crowbar
items.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

items.name: Pouch
items.description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch (described earlier in this section).

traits: I always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
I blow up at the slightest insult.
ideals: Honor. I don't steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)
Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
Charity. I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)
Greed. I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)
People. I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
Redemption. There's a spark of good in everyone. (Good)
bonds: I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
Someone I loved was killed because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.
I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
I'm searching for a treasure that will make me rich for the rest of my life.
flaws: When I see something valuable, I can't help but think about how to steal it.
When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
I have a 'tell' that reveals when I'm lying.
I turn tail and run when things look bad.
An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.

activeQuests.title: The First Step
activeQuests.description: You awake in a strange clearing. The air is fresh, but the silence is heavy. You must get your bearings.

objectives.description: Master the Booklet: View all pages (Character, Map, Quests, Equipment, Codex)
Study Your Gear: Examine an item in your inventory
Begin the Journey: Move to a neighboring hex

storySummary: started their journey as a Half-Elf Barbarian with the Criminal background.
lastNarrative: (Threatened! Disadvantage) Dam's projectile strikes Eagle cleanly. (2 damage) before ending their turn.

conversationHistory.content: __OPENING_SCENE__

A searing sun beats down on your face, dragging you from a deep, dreamless sleep. The scent of dry grass and distant earth fills your nostrils. You blink, vision blurring then sharpening, to find yourself sprawled amidst a vast, undulating sea of plains. The sky above is an unforgiving, cloudless blue, but a low, distant rumble of thunder stirs from somewhere far off, a subtle vibration that seems to tickle the very air. You push yourself up, your muscles aching with a soreness that speaks of unfamiliar exertion, yet your body feels strong, primal. Your name, Dam, is the only anchor in a mind that feels otherwise empty of recent memories. How did you come to be here, alone in this wild expanse? To the south, the plains stretch endlessly, seemingly merging with the horizon. North, a collection of broken stone and crumbling walls hints at ancient ruins. Far to your southeast, a faint, almost shimmering haze suggests a burgeoning urban sprawl, while to your southwest, the land rises into a series of rolling hills. The northeastern vista is consumed by the dark, dense canopy of a forest, and to the northwest, a patchwork of green and gold suggests cultivated farmland. What do you do, Dam? Do you try to recall your past, survey your immediate surroundings, or choose a direction to begin your journey?
/item_add shortsword 1

The plains stretch out before you, a vast expanse under the morning sun. To your south, the plains continue, seemingly without end. To the north, the faint outlines of ancient ruins hint at forgotten histories. A distant city shimmers to the southeast, while rolling hills lie to the southwest. Northeast, a dense forest marks a change in the landscape, and to the northwest, you can just make out cultivated farmland. Far to the south, the landscape shifts to a frigid tundra, with more farmland beyond that to the southeast. Majestic mountains rise in the far south-southwest. In the far north, more plains merge with distant forests to the northeast, and gentle hills to the northwest. To the far southwest, another urban area can be seen on the horizon. The shortsword now rests in your inventory.
/item_add shortbow 1

The morning sun casts long shadows across the vast plains. To your south, the plains stretch endlessly, while directly north, the faint silhouettes of ancient ruins pierce the horizon. Southeast, a distant city shimmers, and to the southwest, rolling hills beckon. A thick forest lies to the northeast, and to your northwest, the patchwork of farmland is just visible. Beyond these immediate sights, the distant tundra lies far to the south, with more farmland to the southeast. Mountains rise far to the southwest. The northern horizon reveals more plains, with another forest to the northeast and hills to the northwest. The far west holds a distant urban area.
/item_add arrow 20

The vast plains stretch out before you, a sea of muted winter grasses that whisper in the gentle morning breeze. To your north, the skeletal remains of ancient ruins pierce the horizon, their broken structures hinting at forgotten histories. Southeast, a faint haze suggests the presence of an urban center, while the southwest is dominated by rolling hills, their peaks still touched with the chill of dawn. A dark line of forest marks the northeast, and to the northwest, signs of cultivated farmland are visible. Farther off, to the south, the plains give way to the stark white of tundra, and in the distance to your southwest, you can just make out the jagged silhouettes of mountains.
/move N

You head north across the plains. The sun at its high point casts a bright, if somewhat pale, light across the flat land. To your south, the beginnings of the Tundra are visible, a stark change from the plains you now traverse. In the distance to the north, you can just make out what looks like the crumbled remains of ancient structures, shrouded in the haze of distance. To your east, farmland stretches, while the west reveals gentle hills. The far-off jungle to the south, and the distant mountains to the southeast and southwest, remain on the horizon, their features blurred by the distance.
/move N

The biting wind across the Tundra whips at your face as you trudge north. The vast, treeless expanse remains largely unchanged, save for the distant, undulating plains that stretch to the horizon. As you continue your journey, a sudden, unnatural silence descends. The constant howl of the wind, the crunch of your boots on the frozen ground, even the distant, faint caw of a raven â€” all abruptly cease. It lasts for only a breath, a chilling void of sound, before the world's natural symphony resumes, leaving an unsettling echo in its wake.
/move NW

The biting wind whips around you as you trudge northwest. The plains gradually give way to more rugged terrain, and the distant, snow-capped peaks of what you now recognize as mountains loom larger with every step. The deep night makes the ascent treacherous, with shadows dancing and shifting, obscuring the path ahead. The air grows noticeably colder, and the faint sound of the wind whistling through unseen crags replaces the open expanse's mournful sigh.
/move SW

You trudge southwest, the biting wind whipping around you as the mountains give way to a desolate tundra. The ground underfoot becomes a mix of frozen earth and sparse, hardy vegetation. To your south and far southwest, the tundra stretches into the distance, shrouded in the deepening night. To the far north, the faint glow of an urban settlement hints at civilization, while to the far northeast, a range of hills rises from the horizon. The distant plains to the southeast and the mountains to the north are now obscured by the rugged terrain.
/move SW

The biting wind whips around you as you trudge southwest across the frozen tundra. The deep night offers little in the way of visual cues, but the endless, undulating expanse of snow and ice remains consistent. In the distance, to your far south and southwest, the tundra stretches into the inky blackness, an uncharted wilderness. The air grows colder with each step, and the silence is broken only by the crunch of snow beneath your boots and the howl of the wind.
/move SE

You clamber over sharp, craggy rocks, the biting wind whipping at your face as you head southeast. The vast, snow-dusted mountains continue their relentless ascent around you, their peaks shrouded in the predawn gloom. To your immediate southeast, the mountains stretch onward, their unyielding ridges hinting at further challenges. In the far distance, to the south, you discern the faint, undulating lines of hills, while further to the southeast, the immense, flat expanse of the plains begins to emerge from the lingering darkness. The distant tundra, a bleak, desolate vista, also looms on the far southeastern horizon.
/target enemy_2

As you target the second eagle, a low, guttural rumble echoes through the mountains, the ground beneath your feet trembling almost imperceptibly. It's a sound that seems to come from deep within the earth, quickly fading but leaving an unsettling silence in its wake. The eagles, however, seem unfazed, their sharp eyes still fixed on you.
/target enemy_0
You focus your barbarian rage on the nearest Eagle, a magnificent bird with sharp talons and an even sharper beak. It circles above you, its shadow momentarily eclipsing the dim, pre-dawn light.
/target enemy_1
You focus your attention on the nearest eagle, its sharp talons and beak glinting in the pale moonlight. It circles menacingly, ready to dive.
/target enemy_1
You focus your attention on the nearest eagle, a majestic creature with keen eyes and a sharp beak, circling menacingly in the cold mountain air.
/move 0 41
The three eagles descend from the sky, their talons extended. You find yourself in the midst of a fierce aerial assault. What do you do?
/target enemy_2

As you target the second eagle, a low, distant rumble echoes through the mountains, a deep growl that seems to vibrate the very air. The eagles, seemingly unfazed, continue their aggressive dance. One of the eagles swoops down, its talons extended, aiming directly for your head.
/target enemy_2

As you target the second eagle, a low, distant rumble echoes through the mountains, a sound like heavy boulders shifting deep within the earth. A shiver, not entirely from the cold, runs down your spine. The two eagles, perhaps sensing your focus, circle tighter, their beady eyes fixed on you, waiting for an opportunity to strike.
/target enemy_0
You focus your wild, barbarian rage on the majestic eagle, its keen eyes now locked onto you with a predatory glint.

High in the mountains, a tense standoff began. Dam, poised defensively, peppered the distant Eagle with arrows, slowly chipping away at its resolve. The Eagle, relentless, pressed its aerial assault, closing the distance despite Dam's volley. Finally, the avian predator descended, its talons striking Dam with fierce blows. Just as the Eagle claimed triumph, Dam, with a final, desperate shot, pierced its attacker, collapsing the mighty bird in a flurry of feathers.

codexEntries.title: The Sky's Majesty: The Eagle
codexEntries.content:
The Eagle, a majestic creature of the skies, is renowned for its keen eyesight and powerful talons. With a wingspan that can reach up to 8 feet, these birds of prey are a symbol of freedom and strength in many cultures. Their feathers, a mix of brown and white, shimmer in the sunlight as they soar through the heavens, striking fear into the hearts of their prey and admiration into the souls of those who witness their flight.

**Physicality and Biology:**
Eagles are known for their sharp, hooked beaks and powerful talons, which they use to tear flesh and grasp prey. Their eyes are incredibly keen, allowing them to spot movement from great heights. They are believed to have a lifespan of up to 30 years in the wild, though some legends speak of eagles living for centuries, their spirits bound to the very essence of the sky.

**Ecology:**
Eagles are solitary creatures, preferring to hunt alone. They are known to nest high in the mountains or on tall trees, their nests made of sticks and lined with soft materials. They feed on a variety of prey, including fish, small mammals, and other birds. Their hunting strategy involves soaring high above their prey, then diving at incredible speeds to strike with deadly precision.

**Myths and Legends:**
In many cultures, eagles are seen as messengers of the gods, their flight paths interpreted as omens. Some legends speak of eagles carrying the souls of the dead to the afterlife. In the realm of Eldoria, it is said that the first eagle was created from the feathers of a fallen angel, its cry echoing the lament of the heavens.

**Adventurer's Tale:**
'We were lost in the mountains, the snow blinding and the cold biting. Then, we saw it - an eagle, its wings outstretched, soaring above us. It was like a beacon of hope, a sign that we weren't alone. It led us to a cave, warm and dry, where we found shelter. I swear, that eagle was no ordinary bird. It was a guardian, a spirit of the mountains. We owe our lives to it.' - Thora, a seasoned adventurer.

notifications.message: New codex entry created: The Sky's Majesty: The Eagle
